concept.title: Starting and Stopping Agents and Services

section.title: Starting and Stopping the Services and Agents
section.p: You can start and stop all containerized services and agents with one command. You can also start and stop the agents and services individually.
To start all agents and services, proceed as follows:

note.p: Make sure that the OpenStack Keystone service is up when executing the command.

section.p: To start individual agents and services, run docker-compose up as follows:
Replace services by the names of the services you want to start. For a list of the service names, refer to .
Example for starting Kafka and the Notification Engine:

p.codeblock: $ docker-compose -f docker-compose-metric.yml -f docker-compose-log.yml up kafka monasca-notification

section.p: When starting a service that depends on other services, the other services are automatically started. If you start Kafka, for example, Zookeeper is automatically started when executing the example command.

note.p: For starting the Metrics Agent, it is required to start the collector service (agent-collector) and the forwarder service (agent-forwarder).

section.p: To stop all agents and services, proceed as follows:
To stop individual agents and services, run docker-compose stop as follows:
Replace services by the names of the services you want to stop. For a list of the service names, refer to .
Example for stopping Kafka and the Notification Engine:
section.codeblock: $ docker-compose -f docker-compose-metric.yml -f docker-compose-log.yml stop kafka monasca-notification

note.p: For stopping the Metrics Agent, it is required to stop the collector service (agent-collector) and the forwarder service (agent-forwarder).

section.p: To check the status of all agents and services, run docker-compose ps as follows:
To view the status of an individual container, run docker-compose ps as follows:
Replace services by the names of the services you want to stop. For a list of the service names, refer to .
section.codeblock: $ docker-compose -f docker-compose-metric.yml -f docker-compose-log.yml stop kafka monasca-notification

note.p: Run docker-compose ps in a separate shell unless you used docker-compose up -d for installing the Monitoring Service.
